divs: sighting detailsi was leaving work (on the east side of columbus, ohio, near easton). as i walked to the parking lot i noticed a flat object in the distance. i thought it first to be an airplane. as i looked closer, it appeared to oscillate. i stopped and observed as closely as possible and watched until i could no longer see it. the object moved from south-east to north-west of my position passing overhead. and i noted that i could see up through the center. it was virtually identical, in shape, to an 8mm washer (the kind used between a nut\bolt). the cloud ceiling was low, but there was no haze. it was not yet dusk, so visibility was high. the object contrasted sharply against the lit sky. there was no light source (sun, etc.) disrupting my vision. i can not estimate an altitude, but the object was below the cloud ceiling as it was clearly visible. i could not have seen the object more clearly. trajectory (speed and direction) appeared constant. i heard no sound. at arm's length, when directly overhead, the object extended just over the width of my thumb. i observed the object until it became too distant (north-west) to observe. as soon as i could no longer see the object, i got into my car and drew diagrams of the object, the direction of travel, my position in relation to the sidewalk\trees\etc. the movement of the object, and i noted the time of the event. i do have the diagrams and drawings, and can make those available if necessary. (i do not have a scanner and would need to get my hand-drawings scanned at a copy center). the event happened one hour and 10 minutes prior to my entry of this report. i noticed the object due to its contrast to the sky, its unusual motion, and due to my interest in such topics. my feelings\reactions were curiosity. i was slightly excited to be witnessing, yet trying to determine what the object might be - a lightweight balloon, a plastic disc, etc. only when i exhausted the alternatives (as i observed the object), i decided to make notes and submit the report. i was calm and clear-headed through the event.
Summary: oscillating disc with constant altitude and trajectory south-east to north-west passed directly overhead
trends: There have been 70 other sightings in Columbus
There were no other sightings in Columbus on or around December 20th 2007
